pullRequest.body:
The lemma [Function.iterate_prod_map](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Dynamics/PeriodicPts.html#Function.iterate_prod_map) is too fundamental to belong to a Dynamics folder.

It is moved to Data.Prod.Basic. The name of the lemma is changed from `iterate_prod_map` to `Prod.map_iterate`, which is more coherent with the usual naming (see `Continuous.iterate`, `pow_iterate`...) and thus more searchable.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9776986066/job/26990673449)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9776986066/job/26990673227)
Thanks for your contribution to mathlib! I have two small comments. When you have made this change, please mark as `awaiting-review` again. Thanks!

Please keep the #align statement: you can change the second item to account for the rename.
```suggestion
#align function.iterate_prod_map Prod.map_iterate

In addition, mathlib policy is that whenever you rename a lemma, you add an alias for the old name with a deprecation warning. (This way, code using the old name still compiles, but emits a warning pointing to the new name --- this makes for a much nicer experience in projects depending on mathlib.) Please add such an alias; the syntax is like so:
`@[deprecated (since := "2024-07-02")] alias Function.iterate_prod_map := Prod.map_iterate`.
Done. Thanks for the information!

Thanks - can you move the deprecation alias to the new file as well? I *think* this is a more natural place...
and I presume the dynamics file imports `Data/Prod/Basic` anyway, so this has no consequences for anybody importing `Dynamics`.
Done! Just have to wait for the thing to build.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: move iterate_prod_map to `Data.Prod.Basic`
